headline: Gourmet Mushroom Risotto
description: This authentic Italian mushroom risotto takes time to prepare, but it's worth the wait. It's the perfect complement for grilled meats and chicken dishes.

video.description: Authentic Italian-style risotto is cooked the slow and painful way, and the results are worth it. The recipe in this video complements grilled meats and chicken dishes very well, and it's great for meal prep.
video.name: How to Make Gourmet Mushroom Risotto

name: Gourmet Mushroom Risotto
recipeIngredient: 6 cups chicken broth, or as needed
sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Warm broth in a saucepan over low heat.

Meanwhile, warm 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add portobello and white mushrooms; cook and stir until soft, about 3 minutes. Remove mushrooms and their liquid to a bowl; set aside.
Add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil to the saucepan. Stir in shallots and cook for 1 minute. Add rice; cook and stir until rice is coated with oil and pale, golden in color, about 2 minutes.
Pour in wine, stirring constantly until wine is fully absorbed. Add 1/2 cup warm broth to the rice, and stir until the broth is absorbed.
Continue adding broth, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly, until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, yet firm to the bite, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Remove from heat. Stir in reserved mushrooms and their liquid, butter, chives, and Parmesan cheese.
Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: In order to get that beautiful, creamy consistency a good risotto is so noted for, I found 15-20 minutes of cooking time was not nearly long enough. The simmering broth must be added little by little, cooked and stirred till it's absorbed, then repeating this step, ladle by ladle of broth, until the risotto is tender but not mushy, the broth is absorbed, and the starches break down resulting in creamy risotto - however long that takes. In my case, it probably took twice as long as the recipe directed, but then I cooked this at moderate heat in order to release the starches slowly. The end result was a creamy risotto with great flavor, the perfect complement to the pork piccata I served it with.
Great - used Noilly Prat vermouth - better than wine - I also add chilli flakes really picks it up Roll leftovers in balls dip in flour and shallow fry / bake - beautiful
I added chunks of chicken with a side dish of steamed buttered asparagus for a complete meal.

I added some dried wild mushrooms and topped it off with Frank's red hot. Delicious and straightforward - once the recipe is in the adding wine phase, you can take it easy, putting a half cup of white wine into the risotto and into you. Overall tasty and makes you feel like you've made something that takes more effort :)

My friend made a batch this weekend and I'm still thinking about it. We used a mix of baby bellas and shiitake mushrooms and balsamic vinegar parmesan (find it in the fancy cheese section in a wedge - don't use the shredded bagged stuff! You won't be sorry!).

Extremely successful, tasty and easy to make (only labor intensive). I tried it once with butter and cheese and once with olive oil and no cheese (vegan version), they taste equally fantastic. I agreed with the comment saying half the mushroom portion. Love how this easy recipe make every guest satisfied and happy!

I've made this many times with 250 g closed cap mushroom and 250 g chestnut mushrooms as well as with only 250 g mushrooms. I didn't add any cheese or butter to make it vegan. I lowered the amount of oil to one teaspoon and cut out the salt as the veggie stock was enough. I used 4 oxo stock cubes with 1 litre of boiled water. My husband, daughter, and I loved this. It was really tasty. To me, it didn't need any cheese. Though if I make this for guest, I may offer some Gary (vegan cheese) to grate on it.

We didn't add chives as we are not a fan. It was srtill amazing!
Nice combination, great form, I added a little garlic and some pine nuts to mine then saute them with the onions.

This is the best risotto recipe I've ever found. It works with veggie broth or water in place of chicken broth for a vegetarian version, too. You can also sub different cheeses and replace the white wine with another alcohol or water. Cognac and gruyere made a nice combination.
YUMMY! I used veggie stock instead of chicken b/c I'm a vegetarian and it came out very well :) Thanks for a great risotto recipe...plus it wasn't that long once I had everything ready :)

As vegetarians, we substituted vegetable or mushroom broth and only used one type of mushroom. Nonetheless, this is easily one of the best risottos we've tasted. It's also quick and easy to make. At least four friends have taken this recipe home the same night they tasted it. 

Kudos!

Instead of portobello and white mushrooms, I used agaricus augustus mushrooms I foraged!! I also withheld the cheese to let the mushroom flavor shine. This is sooooo yummy. It’s the first time I’ve ever made risotto and the instructions with pictures made it so easy to follow. I’m definitely making this one again!
Great instructions, easy to prepare and it was absolutely delicious! Thank you!

Perfect basic recipe you can build on. I've been making risotto for years now. One huge thing I have learned is that cook-time varies from stove to stove. So keep that in mind. On my old (gas) stove, it took a couple of hours. On my new (also gas) stove, less than an hour. Same Calphalon skillet. On my mom's electric stove, somewhere in between and I REALLY had to stir all the time. Might have been her skillet. The great thing about risotto is that, while it is kind of fancy, you can add just about anything you have on hand. Broccoli, peppers, bacon, beans I suppose. I once used red wine in lieu of white, and added bite-size pieces of rib-eye. The risotto turned out pink! There were no leftovers. I add very little butter, but plenty of parmesan. Also, I start with plenty of onions and garlic. I start everything with onions and garlic.

I didnt have any regular wine and I hate the taste of cooking wine, so I added Riesling into it, and it actually gave it a subtle sweetness that I kind of loved. I also made herb grilled chicken alongside it

It was my first time attempting risotto. I could’ve cooked the rice a little longer but the flavors were on point. I saved the leftovers and heated them up the following day in the microwave with more stock. It was perfect.
